headline: American Express Hits Dow Jones On AI Doomsday 'Work Of Fiction'
summary: American Express dragged the Dow Jones Industrial Average lower on Monday afternoon as investors responded to a bleak 2027 AI-driven recession scenario published by Citrini Research, a firm that offers thematic and global macro trading ideas.  The firm says it's bullish on AI's potential and wonders about the economic implications if the impact is so far-reaching that it turns out to be bearish.  American Express, Capital One Financial, Blackstone Financial and KKR were among companies in Citrini's fictional write-up that were among Monday's biggest S&P 500 laggards.

The firm says it's bullish on AI's potential and wonders about the economic implications if the impact is so far-reaching that it turns out to be bearish.  American Express, Capital One Financial, Blackstone Financial and KKR were among companies in Citrini's fictional write-up that were among Monday's biggest S&P 500 laggards.

headline: The Stocks Unscathed by Today’s Selloff
summary: The unlikely star of the stock market lately? Consumer staples stocks. The companies that sell groceries, cigarettes and household products were mostly unscathed by Monday’s selloff. Stocks like Mondelez International, the company behind Oreos and Ritz crackers, and toothpaste maker Colgate-Palmolive were among the top performers in the S&P 500.

headline: Why The Narrative Around Deere (DE) Is Shifting After Q1 Results And Valuation Rerating
summary: Deere's implied fair value estimate has shifted from about US$526.91 to about US$630.40 per share, putting a fresh spotlight on how analysts are thinking about the stock. Several on the Street are tying higher price targets, in some cases into the US$700s, to Deere's Q1 beat, raised guidance and a more constructive view on through cycle earnings power, while others are more cautious about how quickly the story is being priced in. As you read on, you will see how this evolving narrative might...

headline: Bayer, John Deere Further Integrate FieldView and Operations Center to Improve Customer Experience for 2026 Season
summary: ST. LOUIS, February 23, 2026--Bayer and John Deere today announced a new capability that simplifies how U.S. farmers and advisors move from agronomic decisions to precise execution in the field. Beginning this season, customers can wirelessly transfer FieldView™ prescriptions to create Work Plans in Operations Center™. This eliminates the need for thumb drives and other manual steps that slow down field activities and increase the risk of errors.

This eliminates the need for thumb drives and other manual steps that slow down field activities and increase the risk of errors.

headline: Jefferies downgrades Deere as valuation prices in full farm recovery
summary: Investing.com -- Jefferies downgraded Deere & Co to Underperform, saying the stock already reflects a full farm cycle recovery even as U.S. farmer incomes continue to decline. Shares are down more than 1% in Monday premarket trading.

headline: Deere Stock Has Surged 42% This Year. Why You Should Sell, Says Analyst.
summary: Jefferies analyst Stephen Volkmann downgraded shares of farm equipment maker  Deere  to Sell from Hold on Monday.  Deere stock was down 1.2% at $654.90, while  and  futures were both down about 0.2%.  Coming into Monday trading, Deere shares were up an impressive 42% so far this year.

headline: 1 Cash-Producing Stock for Long-Term Investors and 2 We Avoid
summary: While strong cash flow is a key indicator of stability, it doesn’t always translate to superior returns. Some cash-heavy businesses struggle with inefficient spending, slowing demand, or weak competitive positioning.

headline: EU postpones vote on U.S. trade deal after Trump’s latest tariff threat
summary: European officials have reacted with disbelief to President Donald Trump's latest tariff policy, warning that trade deals could be at risk.
